Logic.Pieces

Interface GamePieces

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Bishop, GamePiece, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rock

    public interface GamePieces
    Interface for the GamePieces. As we need to make sure that a number of method exist we will make a "contract" that those methods need to implemented somewhere in Child classes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Boolean containsFriendly(ChessBoard board, Coordinate coordinate)
      Checks if another Square contains a friendly GamePiece.
      Faction getFaction()
      Gets the Faction of the GamePiece
      java.net.URL getImageURL()
      Get the the relative position for the image of the gamePiece
      UnitType getUnitType()
      Gets the UnitType if the GamePiece
      java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> getValidMoves(ChessBoard board, Coordinate currentCoordinates)
      Will return a list of Coordinates that a specific GamePiece can move to.

    • Method Detail

      • getImageURL

        java.net.URL getImageURL()
        Get the the relative position for the image of the gamePiece
        Returns:
        String with relative path

      • getValidMoves

        java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> getValidMoves(ChessBoard board,
                                              Coordinate currentCoordinates)
        Will return a list of Coordinates that a specific GamePiece can move to. Those Coordinates will be valid and inside the ChessBoard.
        Parameters:
        board - The ChessBoard the game is played on
        currentCoordinates - The Coordinate of the GamePiece
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Coordinates with all possible moves

      • containsFriendly

        java.lang.Boolean containsFriendly(ChessBoard board,
                                   Coordinate coordinate)
        Checks if another Square contains a friendly GamePiece.
        Parameters:
        board - The ChessBoard the game is played on
        coordinate - Coordinate of the other GamePiece we want to compare with
        Returns:
        True if same Faction, False if different faction, null if empty

      • getFaction

        Faction getFaction()
        Gets the Faction of the GamePiece
        Returns:
        Faction of the GamePiece

      • getUnitType

        UnitType getUnitType()
        Gets the UnitType if the GamePiece
        Returns:
        UnitType of the GamePiece
